content.description:
This is one of a few good low-level warm-ups on the boulder.

Start on an obvious right-facing flake a few feet off the ground.  Move up through more flakes, crimps, and jugs to top out over the high point above you or escape left into the "U".
content.protection: A pad and a spotter.  The landing is flat, but there are some small potentially ankle rolling rocks underneath this problem, so make sure you're aware of them when placing your pads.  However, this is a very easy problem and tops out low at around 10 - 11 feet, so it should be pretty safe.
content.location: On the far right of the north-east face of the Device Ignitor boulder.  The right-facing flakes should be pretty obvious.

content.description:
This is one of a few good low level warm-ups on the boulder.

Sit start with good crimps on either side of the vertical crack and a good pocket for a toe.  Climb up and slightly right through good crimps and incut lips.

There are a variety of holds you can use, and using certain holds does not make the route any easier or harder than it would be otherwise.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter.  The landing is nice and flat and the top out is not very high (i.e., around 10 feet)
content.location: This problem is on the east face of the Device Ignitor boulder.  It follows a vertical crack in the face that sits about 5 - 6 feet right of the start of Device Ignitor Right.

content.description:
Start below the bulge with a left on a small crimp and a right side-pulling on a small sharp flake.  Shoot up for a good lip and finish straight up over the bulge with good holds the higher you go.

The hardest move is probably the start.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter.  There is a big rock behind the problem that you would likely fall onto if you came off higher on the problem, so make sure you have a pad over it and someone to steady you if you fall.  Also, the small right hand starting flake seems a little fragile, so just be aware you could fall left suddenly if it snaps.  There are other potential holds for a right  hand start that seem less fragile, but they would be harder as well.
content.location: This is on the north point of the Device Ignitor boulder.

content.description: This climb starts on the north arete of the boulder.  It follows the arete all the way to the top.
content.protection: Great flat landing.  It is a short boulder too.
content.location: Just west of the T.P. Boulder.

content.description: This starts in the middle of the boulder on a jug.  Move to the crimp up and left, then grab the pinch/crimp right on the roof, then reach up and over the lip of the boulder.
content.protection: Great flat ground to boulder on.
content.location: This boulder is just west of the T.P. Boulder.  It has a steep overhang.

content.description: This is a line that goes up the left side of the overhang.  It starts on two pockets and moves left. Really fun line with some powerful moves.
content.location: Just west of the T.P. Boulder.

content.description:
This is one of a few warm-ups on this boulder.

Start low on crimps just to the right of the corner between the east and north-east face of the boulder.  Climb up and slightly right.

There are several options for hands at the start and throughout.  Whatever holds you choose will result in the same difficulty level.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter.  The  landing is flat, but the Backhoe boulder sits right behind you, and you could potentially fall into it if you were to stumble coming off problem--probably not likely, though.  The top out is low at around 10 feet.
content.location: This problem is on the north-east face of the Device Ignitor boulder starting just to the right of the corner between the east and north-east faces.
